text: baking and parchment is one of my go-to
healthy cooking techniques it's really
great because everything stays in the
parchment packet all the nutrients all
the flavors all the juices they're all
there and it's really great for things
like fish or poultry or even vegetables
today we're gonna pair a wild salmon
with asparagus shitake mushrooms and a
little bit of lemon zest it's so
delicious start with 8 ounces of
asparagus spears and what I've done
these have them down the center and
that's gonna make them cook nice and
evenly I have 8 ounces of sliced
shiitake mushrooms shiitake mushrooms
are tremendous for flavor texture but
they also have a huge amount of protein
add four sliced scallions this is gonna
add a nice kick finishing touch the zest
of one lemon I don't really like to give
measurements on lemon zest because so
where do you transfer the lemon zest to
a measuring utensil like a teaspoon or
tablespoon measure you lose all those
precious essential oils so I like to
just kind of eyeball it and grade it
directly into whatever I'm cooking
quarter cup of olive oil add salt and
pepper and toss it around you could use
tongs but I'm gonna just get in there
with my hands another great thing about
cooking a parchment is if you pair your
main protein or your main vegetable with
other grains or other vegetables you
have your entire meal ready to go at the
same time this smells really amazing
very springy and fresh let's season the
salmon I'm using about five ounce
fillets preferably wild and my plays are
probably about an inch and a half thick
if yours are a little bit shorter just
modify the cooking time slightly just
take it down by a few minutes and we'll
just set this aside while we make
packets take a piece of parchment paper
that you've cut to about 12 by 17 inches
fold it so that it looks like a book I
find that this is really helpful when
you're trying to orient the items that
are gonna get cooked unfold it
and then grab about a good handful of
asparagus and this is going to create a
really flavorful bed and stay about an
inch away from that center crease this
will give you plenty of room to make
your pleats around the edge next up
salmon the reason I love cooking salmon
and parchment is because it's already
very tender and delicious and full of
those great healthy fats but the
steaming just makes it extra silky we're
going to add our mushrooms and scallions
to the top just about two spoonfuls and
now I'm gonna add a tablespoon of water
you could also use white wine if you
wanted to this is just gonna help
generate a little bit more steam once
it's in the oven so we're ready to
assemble the packet take your left hand
piece just top the bottom and then start
by making a series of very small pleats
and make sure you fold them down tightly
until you've formed a Halfmoon shape
okay so I'm crimping all the way to the
end here and then what I like to do for
this last piece is just turn it under
and that keeps it nice and close during
baking transfer your entire packet to a
rimmed baking sheet and repeat with the
remaining fish I'm gonna bake both of
these trays in the oven at 400 degrees
for about nine minutes that's gonna be
medium rare okay it's been nine minutes
and my salmon is cooked now this is the
really fun part the big reveal
transfer the packet to dinner plate
couldn't be easier
now we're gonna snip them open just be
careful when you're cutting them because
steam is gonna escape you don't want to
burn yourself oh this smells incredible
and it looks so beautiful and all these
wonderful juices and flavors are all
right here in this parchment the only
thing you need to do is squeeze it with
a little bit of lemon your healthy
delicious dinner is served
you
